Everything is 100% perfect except 1 thing....there is not enough of it and not sure of any sequels. With all indie games, they are genius ideas, but little content. Yeah the game is a good length with little repeition outside a few things, but overall experience is beyond commenting on, besides to say it is the best horror game of the year easily.   Why, well, it does have shock value, and jump frights, and still manages to set the mood correctly. Even though it is a guided tour, they still allow us hardcore gamers to get rewarded for searching nooks and crannies with extended content in the form of notes, and reward you with more in your supply of batteries. The best feature is, it doesn't feel guided, or that your on rails. It walks the line between guess work and obvious routes, they achieve this by making a plain 'plan', like 'get to 3rd floor' or 'find the key', which allows you to discover areas and search at your own disgression. The only problem is, your in a facility crawling with lunitacs, and the problem with that is, most are set free to do whatever they want.   Although they lacked many key antagonist in the game, there are 4 special guys who you don't forget which is actually quite a lot for an indie game, the important is covered cause they leave an impression..........and you leave an impression on them. I have to admit, the first 20-30 minutes of the game, are some of the scariest moments in gaming. In real life, no one in their right mind would ever enter......but you have to, if you find a way!!!   Bottomline, it is a must play game for any Indie or Horror fan, with plenty of action, horror, night vision, running, and most importantly, HIDING! I think every gamer should at least play through the first part, it is as amazing.

Outlast.......... I still cant believe I beat this game. I cant bring myself to uninstall it, it is literallty a tool that will break the non believers. By non believers I mean those who don't think video games can be horrifiying. Story is drastically simple, there is a an insane asylum in San Antonio that has completely gone off the grid........ Dark, nobody can get a call through or anything. The main character is an investgative reporter who was just going to knock on the door and ask a couple of questions. That didnt work out to well. The controls are amazing, the ability to climb up ledges is a brilliant touch on the FPS side of things. Along with the ability to turn your head around while you sprint to see if whats chasing you is close or not? Scary and practical to say the least. The visuals are down right haunting, The asylum feels like it was just in working order even though it hasnt been for some time. the obvious feeling that there was a struggle in the facility is very present. The stacking of bed frames and chairs against doors and the destroyed walls show that there has been some kind of a struggle. Attention to detail is shocking, you could literally smell the place sometimes. I have a big complaint amongst all of the praise I have been throwing its way. Wow is it short. I beat this gripping game in roughly 9 hours. If it were 20 or even 40 hours though it might have been too much. So maybe I'm wrong in that department maybe the game was just right. Where do I start? This game is incredible. Set in a giant psychiatric hospital full of deformed, horrifying maniacs, you play as Miles Upshur (funny name) as he tries to escape the asylum because he was dumb enough to go there just so he could get footage of the inhumane experiments that occur there. The main theme of this game is run, hide, or die, which is a common theme in horror games except this game does it very well. The soundtrack is exceptionally pleasing, and the atmosphere is fantastic. In my opinion, the story could have been better, but I think it's good the way it is. The DLC was definitely a great addition to the game and story. Also, the inclusion of different types of maniac inmates who are chasing you was great, and added a bit of uniqueness to each enemy. I'm mostly referring to the main bad guys such as Trager, the Twins, and Chris (little pig guy), but I also mean the normal inmates, as they all tend to have different varied dialogues and personalities from each other that really adds to the creepy insanity that has taken over the asylum. One inmate wants to burn the asylum down, one just wants to stand in the corner, one might want to club your head in just because. The only thing I didn't like was the main character himself, Miles Upshur. He is of course scared and concerned about his situation, but also seems unrealistically jokey in his journal. Umm, no. The new character in Whistleblower is a much better protagonist, and I also liked the new variants from Whistleblower, which is why I liked Whistleblower more than the original game. Finally, one last thing I want to talk about, and it's the most important part... Is it scary? Yes, yes it is. The creepy dark setting combined with being constantly hunted by monstrous deformed men is absolutely horrific. Don't even get me started on the jumpscares. You're already on edge, since Chris (little pig guy) tends to appear out of nowhere, the last thing you need is a guy popping up in your face out of nowhere. All in all, this game is great in all aspects except Miles Upshur sucks, but I still give it 10/10 since the only dialogue he has is his grunts or screams of pain. Good job Red Barrels, can't wait to see Outlast 2.

Graphics:The graphics are very well optimized, so even a low powered computer can run the game on high settings, which is greatly recommended. The atmosphere is absolutely perfect, and horrifying. The sound of footsteps just behind you, and the whir of a crazy cannibal's power saw just behind the back of your head make you feel terrified. Wear headphones. 9/10  Story:The main campaign's story is fantastic, and I'll leave it at that to avoid spoilers. The DLC, Whistleblower, adds more to the main story, answering many questions you may have had. 8.5/10  AI:The AI is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing smart. That's not something to be happy about, because you sure as hell don't have any buddies in this game. Enemies can hear you like they see you-better if you're a dumbass. They will actively search for you. opening lockers and checking under beds. So don't expect to sprint past them and not be heard, little pig. 9/10  Overall, this game is horrifying, but incredibly fun to play. With a pair of headphones, and if you're lucky, a VR kit, this will be the most immersive horror game you'll play.  9/10 would ♥♥♥♥ myself again

First of all Outlast is one of the best horror games I have played. The game takes place in a creepy insane asylum. The game was made by former Ubisoft employees which really shows. The game's graphics are amazing and beautiful in a morbid grotesque way. The game’s atmosphere is dank, dark and uncomfortable. The game also features an amazing night vision camera that adds to the games creepy gritty atmosphere. The game features basic Amnesia style run and hide gameplay with platforming. The game’s night vision camera effects the gameplay by requiring the player to collect batteries to use the camera to be able to see in the dark. The game also features well crafted jumpscares that geniously got me at times. The only thing I found disappointing was the game’s ending but hey nothing's perfect.The game was thrilling and enthralling experience that I will never forget. Outlast is a modern horror masterpiece. Overall Outlast gets a 10/10. I can’t wait for the sequel coming out late 2016. I have heard that Resident Evil 7 is heavily inspired by this game and I am quite happy to hear that.
